sentence.Network_en: Analyses of economic indicators represent the forecaster's " crystal ball ".
sentence.Network_cn: 经济指标的分析,象征着预测者用以占卜的 “ 水晶球 ”.

sentence.Network_en: The weather - forecaster cautioned us about the icy roads.
sentence.Network_cn: 气象预报员提醒我们注意结冰的道路.

sentence.Network_en: It forces the forecaster to be as objective as he possible can be.
sentence.Network_cn: 它迫使预测者尽可能地做到客观无偏见.

entry.def: A forecaster is someone who uses detailed knowledge about a particular activity in order to work out what they think will happen in that activity in the future.

example.ex: Some of the nation's top economic forecasters say the economic recovery is picking up speed.
example.tran: 这个国家的一些顶尖经济预测专家称经济复苏正在加速。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who makes predictions of the future (usually on the basis of special knowledge)

auth_sentence.content: This is significantly below what the Government's official forecaster expects.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is significantly below what the Government's official forecaster expects.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is significantly below what the Government's official forecaster expects.

auth_sentence.content: But the future always surprises us, as every weather forecaster knows.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the future always surprises us, as every weather forecaster knows.

auth_sentence.content: "It's high pressure," says lead forecaster Trevor Smith.
